definition: to complain of an injustice/to lament sb's misfortune
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
bent/to feel wronged
surname Qu
to complain bitterly

sentences.english: Justice was never done but some one complained.
sentences.chinese: 每一次伸張正義都會有人鳴冤叫屈。

sentences.english: The old lady complained indignantly, her lips trembling as she spoke.
sentences.chinese: 同時，我心裏難免爲新加坡的女兒們叫屈和擔憂。

sentences.english: He would, perchance , have pitied this sick man, of the law's making.
sentences.chinese: 他也許會替那個被法律傷害了的人叫屈。

definition: feel wronged
to cry out against injustice/to protest unfairness
to be outraged by an injustice
to come to the aid of sb suffering an injustice/to fight for justice/also written 抱打不平[bao4 da3 bu4 ping2]
to cry out a grievance
to offer an explanation/to plead innocence/to try to defend oneself
to exculpate/to absolve/to exonerate
to complain bitterly
variant of 憤憤不平|愤愤不平[fen4 fen4 bu4 ping2]
to feel indignant/to feel aggrieved
see 打抱不平[da3 bao4 bu4 ping2]
to explain/to justify/to defend (a point of view etc)/to provide an explanation/to try to defend oneself
to plea for leniency/to ask for a favor
to bawl out/to reprimand severely
to accuse wrongly/to treat unjustly/injustice/wronged/not worthwhile
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
